title: Processes - Diff Eq Separation of Variables

content.question: What is the general solution to the differential equation <math alttext="the derivative of y, with respect to x, equals, the fraction with numerator x minus 1, and denominator 3 times y squared, end fraction " display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mi>d</mi><mi>y</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>d</mi><mi>x</mi></mrow></mfrac><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mrow><mi>x</mi><mo>−</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn><msup><mrow><mi>y</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></math> for <math alttext="y greater than 0 " display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>y</mi><mo>></mo><mn>0</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> ?

choices.label: <math alttext="y equals, the fraction with numerator 1, and denominator, open parenthesis, negative three halves times x squared, plus 3 x, plus C, close parenthesis, end fraction" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>y</mi><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><mo>(</mo><mrow><mo>−</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></mfrac><msup><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup></mrow><mo>+</mo><mn>3</mn><mi>x</mi><mo>+</mo><mi>C</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="y equals, open parenthesis, e raised to the, open parenthesis, the fraction 3 times x squared, over 2, end fraction, minus 3 x, plus C, close parenthesis, power, close parenthesis, raised to the one half power" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>y</mi><mo>=</mo><msup><mrow><mo>(</mo><msup><mrow><mi>e</mi></mrow><mrow><mrow><mo>(</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>3</mn><msup><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></mfrac><mo>−</mo><mn>3</mn><mi>x</mi><mo>+</mo><mi>C</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></msup><mo>)</mo></mrow><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></mfrac></mrow></msup></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="y equals, open parenthesis, x squared, minus x, close parenthesis, raised to the one third power, plus C" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>y</mi><mo>=</mo><msup><mrow><mrow><mo>(</mo><msup><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup><mo>−</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></mfrac></mrow></msup><mo>+</mo><mi>C</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="y equals, open parenthesis, the fraction x squared over 2, end fraction, minus x, plus C, close parenthesis, raised to the one third power" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>y</mi><mo>=</mo><msup><mrow><mo>(</mo><mfrac><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></mfrac><mo>−</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>+</mo><mi>C</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></mfrac></mrow></msup></mrow></mstyle></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="y equals, open parenthesis, the fraction x squared over 2, end fraction, minus x, plus C, close parenthesis, raised to the one third power" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>y</mi><mo>=</mo><msup><mrow><mo>(</mo><mfrac><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></mfrac><mo>−</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>+</mo><mi>C</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></mfrac></mrow></msup></mrow></mstyle></math>

topic.text: 7.6: Finding General Solutions Using Separation of Variables

skill.text: Skill 1.E: Apply appropriate mathematical rules or procedures, with and without technology.
